title.narrative: EDUCATION SYSTEM AND PRIMARY EDUCATION

description.narrative: By 2025, the education system has increased capacity to offer inclusive and quality education (including primary) for the most vulnerable children, which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Access To Quality Learning Opportunities (Covid), Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2025, more young children, especially the most vulnerable, benefit from learning, nurturing, care and development at home and in their communities.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2025, the education system has increased capacity to offer inclusive and quality education (including primary) for the mostvulnerable children

description.narrative: In support of high-quality, inclusive education for all children especially during the COVID-19 pandemic,UNICEF supported the digitalisation of the face-to-face teacher training modules endorsed by the Council of Higher Education and MoNE.UNICEF led the national annual Back to Learning (BTL) campaign to facilitate enrolment of children and safe return to formal schools. A communication campaign on this reached more than 10 million people. A three-language information package (Turkish, Arabic and English) was disseminated to organisations to support the sector’s outreach and support activities. A new programme, the Syrian Support Workers, is rolled out and will continue through 2022. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:21/01/2022

Status of programming framework for re--imagine education in Turkey post COVID-19, Text

target.value: 2021:Programming framework developed and presented to at least 3 donors including 1 IFI

actual.value: 2021:Programming framework presented to 3 donors - 1 donor (EU) in entirety, and at least 2 other donors partially (BPRM and SAP). Management also shared the Concept Note with the members of the Gen U Business Advisory Board

title.narrative: Status of pre-service teacher training programme in relation to inclusive education, Text

baseline.value: Pre-service teacher training programme implicitly includes elements on inclusive education

target.value: 2022:Pre-service teacher training programme is aligned with good practices and explicitly includes elements on inclusive education.

title.narrative: Status of Remedial Education programme to support primary school children not reaching minimum proficiency level in basic literacy and numeracy, Text

baseline.value: remedial education programme limited to 3rd grade students
